title: Historic Dugout Cafe dive bar to sell its liquor license to chain restaurant
author: Katelyn Umholtz
bullets: Food News The listed price for the all-alcohol liquor license is $550,000, according to an attorney representing Earls Kitchen + Bar.
The Mendoza Line, seen here, was a weekly comedy show that took place at the historic Dugout Cafe.

Handout The Dugout Cafe, a nearly-century-old dive bar open in Boston since Prohibition’s end, was approved to give its liquor license to a Canadian chain of restaurants looking to open a third location in Greater Boston.

title: Hartford investigating after apparent federal employees deploy pepper spray, drive through protesters, mayor says
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News “We’re in uncharted territory, but we're going to treat it like any other crime that happened in the City of Hartford,” Mayor Arunan Arulampalam said.
Yuki Iwamura / AP, File By Molly Farrar January 13, 2026 | 10:32 AM 3 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

Apparent federal employees who drove through a group of protesters attempting to block their exit, striking one, and who deployed pepper spray in the incident last week in Hartford could face criminal charges, the city’s mayor said.

title: Joe Mazzulla repeated the same two words for an entire press conference after Celtics’ loss
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update Mazzulla was clearly unhappy with the officiating at the end of Boston's loss to the Pacers.

title: Meet the couple behind the Boston accent video taking over TikTok and Instagram
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Local News Andover's Romano Duncan has gone viral for his amazing Boston accent, captured by his girlfriend Kacey Levesque.
Thanks to a video posted by his girlfriend Kacey Levesque, left, Romano Duncan's Boston accent has taken social media by storm.

title: Flu cases are surging across Massachusetts. Have you gotten sick?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tell Us As hospitalizations climb and Boston opens free vaccination clinics, we want to hear how this flu season is affecting you.
A man receives a COVID and flu vaccine shot at Boston City Hall on Jan.

title: 4 things to know about Patriots divisional-round playoff foe Texans
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots Drake Maye and the Patriots’ offense will have their hands full against a dynamic Texans defense that can generate plenty of pressure.
Drake Maye made his first NFL start last season against Houston.

(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) By Conor Ryan January 13, 2026 | 6:25 AM 5 minutes to read The New England Patriots will look to punch their ticket to the AFC title game next Sunday when they play host to the Houston Texans in the AFC divisional round on Sunday afternoon.

title: Patriots to play Houston Texans in AFC divisional round
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots will host Houston at Gillette Stadium on Sunday, with kick-off set for 3 p.
m.
Drake Maye will have his hands full with Houston's elite defense.

title: Boston’s homicide rate increases 30% from 2024, from 24 killings to 31
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News 2025’s 31 homicides is still the lowest in the last two decades, excluding 2024, Boston Police Commissioner Michael Cox said.
Boston Police Commissioner Michael Cox, Boston Mayor Michelle Wu, and Isaac Yablo, Senior Advisor for Public Safety in 2024.
Suzanne Kreiter/The BostonGlobe ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Finally given NHL shot, Bruins’ Jonathan Aspirot has been difference-maker on defense
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins "You talk about paying your dues.
You keep pushing for the dream.
" Jonathan Aspirot has been a key piece on Boston's blue line.
